title: "rclone copy --max-age=1h --no-traverse" is slower after version 1.69.3.
body:
<!--

We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

**STOP and READ**
**YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put into solving the problem and please be specific.
People are volunteering their time to help! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!

If you think you might have found a bug, try to replicate it with the latest beta (or stable).
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If you can still replicate it or just got a question then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

for a quick response instead of filing an issue on this repo.

If nothing else helps, then please fill in the info below which helps us help you.

**DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.

You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.

Make sure to include a log obtained with '-vv'.

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Using versions after 1.69.3, `rclone copy --max-age=1h --no-traverse` for the Proton Drive remote (I haven't tested any other remotes) is much slower.  Using version 1.69.3, this command takes just 2.8 s.  Using version 1.71.1, this command takes 17 m 2.1 s.  This command suffers from similar poor performance with other versions after 1.69.3.  Running the command using version 1.69.3 _without_ `--no-traverse` performs just as poorly as versions after 1.69.3 _with_ `--no-traverse`.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

1.71.1

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

FreeBSD 13.3-RELEASE-p4

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Proton Drive

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
rclone copy --checkers=12 --copy-links --max-age=1h --metadata --no-traverse --protondrive-replace-existing-draft=true --verbose=3 /mnt/zdd/share/Archive/Documents proton:Archive/Documents
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2025/09/29 14:43:00 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.71.1" starting with parameters ["/mnt/zdd/home/derek/bin/rclone" "copy" "--checkers=12" "--copy-links" "--max-age=1h" "--metadata" "--no-traverse" "--protondrive-replace-existing-draft=true" "--verbose=3" "/mnt/zdd/share/Archive/Documents" "proton:Archive/Documents"]
2025/09/29 14:43:00 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "/mnt/zdd/share/Archive/Documents"
2025/09/29 14:43:00 DEBUG : Using config file from "/mnt/zdd/home/derek/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2025/09/29 14:43:00 DEBUG : local: detected overridden config - adding "{12rtk}" suffix to name
2025/09/29 14:43:00 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "/mnt/zdd/share/Archive/Documents" to be canonical "local{12rtk}:/mnt/zdd/share/Archive/Documents"
2025/09/29 14:43:00 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "proton:Archive/Documents"

2025/09/29 14:43:00 DEBUG : proton drive root link ID 'Archive/Documents': Has cached credentials
```
